channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2024040585
item.description:
Report E-2024040585

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: JANESVILLE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The hose connection was leaking when the driver started his unload. When they hook up they are to do a twist test on the hose to make sure it doesn't spin at all. Any movement indicates either the gasket is bad or the camlocks that lock it down may need to be shimmed. It did not twist when he tried moving it and the gaskets all looked good. After he applied shims though it did stop the leak. We're taking this hose out of use going forward and getting it back to the manufacturer so they can inspect it and replace the fitting on the end. 8 ounces hit the ground beyond the spill bucket.

item.title: Report E-2024040540
item.description:
Report E-2024040540

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-18
  • City: HUDSON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) pound of material released from one (1) 5-gallon plastic pail. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and placed the recovered material into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail. The generated waste will remain onsite for the Dayton Freights team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024041167
item.description:
Report X-2024041167

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR LEAKING PACKAGE IN AN UNLOAD TRAILER. SPILL WAS CONTAINED AND TAKEN TO DMP FOR PROCESSING. UPON INSPECTION, RESPONDER SAW THAT THERE WAS AN AEROSOL CAN (NOT THE LEAKING ITEM) IN THE BOX THOUGH THE BOX DIDN'T HAVE A LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMOND ON THE OUTSIDE. RMP WAS NOTIFIED. RMP CALLED HAZMAT HELP DESK.

item.title: Report E-2024040511
item.description:
Report E-2024040511

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: JANESVILLE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 11, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN3265 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately eight (8) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed absorbents to the release and worked them in with hand tools. All impacted materials were collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.
